comment.author: 76381637@N08
comment._content: I am increasingly of the opinion that this photograph was taken in the Domain looking toward  Government House. The soldiers present though without fineals on their helmets are officers of The New South Wales Infantry 1885. I realise this is conjecture. Is a contemporary photograph of Government House available for comparison?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The Domain is not that big.   Even allowing for smoggy old photos,  the trees in the far background of this photo are almost a mile away.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
This image may well be part of the series of images from the 1884 Easter military encampment at Windsor - see Bob Meade's comments with the photo below.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/8355859723/]
-AG
